thread.title: Manchester United news: 'Wet floor' sign sparks Steven Gerrard chant at Wembley | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United news: 'Wet floor' sign sparks Steven Gerrard chant at Wembley | Metro News

author: Evan Bartlett For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Manchester United news: 'Wet floor' sign sparks Steven Gerrard chant at Wembley | Metro News
text:
Evan Bartlett for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 2:15 pm United fans found a ‘wet floor’ sign at Wembley as their side beat Southampton 3-2 (@dalyjames123/Sky Sports) 
It wasn’t just on the pitch that Manchester United were having fun on Sunday. 
Fans in the concourse at Wembley stadium found a ‘wet floor’ sign and started a huge chant poking fun at Steven Gerrard . 
‘Steve Gerrard, Gerrard. He slipped on his f***ing a**e. He gave it to Demba Ba. Steve Gerrard, Gerrard,’ they sang with glee while one supporter held the sign triumphantly aloft. 
The song relates to Gerrard’s infamous slip against Chelsea which cost his side the Premier League title in 2014. 
Watch a clip of the song, captured by James Daly , below: To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
As a hapless steward came forward to retrieve the sign, the United fans changed tack. 
‘You Scouse b d, you Scouse b d,’ they chanted. 
Liverpool had been Premier League leaders that season three years ago. 
Brendan Rodgers had found a seemingly winning formula built around the attacking threat of Gerrard, Raheem Sterling and Luis Suarez. 
But it wasn’t to be. Gerrard’s stumble at Anfield in late April allowed Ba through for a crucial goal just before half-time and Liverpool never recovered.
